intro: Coreocarpus shrevei var. typicus, commonly known as the Shreve's coreocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, woody fruits known as coreocarps, which are distinctive in shape and structure. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its deep root system and drought-resistant foliage. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
